forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 4pm, then a slight chance of rain between 4pm and 5pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, just past noon on this cool December day, the atmosphere carries a whisper of moisture. The forecast hints at a fleeting dance of rain showers before the clock strikes four, but for now, the sky has settled into a mostly clear canvas, occasionally interrupted by fleeting clouds. While the temperature sits comfortably around 58 degrees, an afternoon breeze from the northwest teases the tree branches, bringing with it a sense of chill and a gentle reminder to bundle up in layers. 

Visible signs of the city's characteristic fog are softened at a distance, briefly wrapping the Golden Gate in a veil of mystery. Yet, it appears this afternoon will present just a slight chance of rain, so while the air may feel damp and brisk, one can take solace in the illuminating hints of sunlight peeking through the clouds. For those venturing outside, a well-worn scarf and a light jacket will serve well, perfect for an afternoon stroll. Perhaps a visit to a local café to savor a warm cup of coffee or tea, allowing for moments of reflection as the day unfolds—a welcome way to embrace the dramatic yet beautiful weather of the city.
